channel.title: Guitar problem
channel.description:
So today I was playing my guitar through amp and I noticed some staticky sounds coming through, not all the time but its most audible when I bend a string (even if I mute it, which is odd). Its probably not a problem with the pickups because I get noise from either pickup (theres two). Also strange is when I turn down the tone knob to 0, the noise disappears completely. I've been carrying my guitar a lot lately so I guess some wiring could be faulty but at a glance I didn't notice anything out of place.
Any ideas?

item.title: Guitar problem
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:16, topic:301648”][quote author=ownagesbot link=topic=397941.msg2965956#msg2965956 date=1253574757]
is da guitar grounded proper? hav u tested its grounding? no dry joints?
[/quote]
how can you test it?[/quote]

Get a multimeter and test different points.

Read full topic

item.title: Guitar problem
item.dc:creator: @Unlimited1 .Unlimited
item.description:
@Unlimited1 wrote:

Old Rsc Player:

can u record a part and put it on the web so we/I can hear what it sounds like?

[quote=“la­wl, post:11, topic:301648”]i tried plugging guitar into comp, its a lot less audible and sometimes doesn’t happen at all… but still happens occasionally
(amp probably has more gain)

next i plugged amp into comp, and recorded the noise: (there is a bit of muted string sound, ignore that)
http://lawl.kicks-ass.net/static.wav[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Guitar problem
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

don’t spose you could record any of the noise? “staticy sound” is not particularly descriptive

offtopic: his guitar almost certainly does not have a TRS jack

Read full topic

item.title: Guitar problem
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:8, topic:301648”]Can you remove the jack plate from the guitar easily (easy on strats etc)? Perhaps there’s a loose connection there.

Once, An internal cable managed to tangle itself which lead to the trs jack not touching one of the contacts.[/quote]
i did check inside and i didnt find anything wrong

SomethingToHide:

And you don’t hear it if you’re not playing out the amp?

its static-like sound, how would it be heard otherwise??

Read full topic

item.title: Guitar problem
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Can you remove the jack plate from the guitar easily (easy on strats etc)? Perhaps there’s a loose connection there.

Once, An internal cable managed to tangle itself which lead to the trs jack not touching one of the contacts.

Read full topic

item.title: Guitar problem

item.title: Guitar problem
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“Archer, post:5, topic:301648”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=397941.msg2953666#msg2953666 date=1252702897]

I would swap out guitar cords first to see if that is the problem.

nope, didn’t help
[/quote]

Is your outlet for your amp grounded? If not problems like this can happen, I am getting mine grounded because of some unwanted noise.[/quote]
the outlet is grounded, unless the 3 prong plug is fake or something
ill try out a different amp on monday and see what happens.

Read full topic
